definition: The scientific study of the Sun, Moon, stars, planets and other objects in space.
examples: She wants to study astronomy at university.
Astronomy teaches us about distant galaxies.

extra.memory_tip: Astronomy = naming and knowing the stars.

definition: In addition to; apart from; moreover.
examples: Besides apples, she likes bananas. (prep.)
It's too late to go, besides it's raining. (adv.)

definition: A large bowl-shaped hole on the surface of a planet or caused by an explosion; to form such a hole.
examples: A meteorite left a huge crater. (noun)
Bombs cratered the road. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Crater = giant dent in ground or Moon.

definition: A unit for measuring temperature or angles; a qualification awarded by a university.
examples: Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius.
She earned a history degree.

extra.memory_tip: Degree = measure of heat, angles, or study.

definition: A straight line passing from side to side through the centre of a circle or sphere.
examples: The circle has a diameter of 10 cm.
Twice the radius equals the diameter.

extra.memory_tip: Diameter = line straight across the middle.

definition: To look steadily and intently; a steady, intent look.
examples: He gazed at the night sky. (verb)
Her gaze fell on the distant hills. (noun)

definition: The natural force that attracts objects towards one another, especially the force that makes things fall to Earth.
examples: Gravity keeps our feet on the ground.
The Moon's gravity causes tides.

definition: To throw back light, heat, sound or an image; to think deeply about something.
examples: Mirrors reflect light.
Take time to reflect on your progress.

definition: An instrument that makes distant objects appear nearer and larger; to collapse parts into one another.
examples: He looked at Jupiter through a telescope. (noun)
The metal poles telescope into each other for storage. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Telescope = star viewer or fold-in tube.

definition: All of space and everything in it, including stars, planets and galaxies.
examples: Astronomers study the origins of the universe.
The universe is vast and still expanding.
